intro: Haloragis aspera, commonly known as the rough stellaria, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in sandy or rocky soils, often in coastal or inland regions. The plant features slender, upright stems covered in rough, bristly hairs. Its small white or pink flowers appear in clusters, and it produces distinctive, three-lobed seed capsules. Haloragis aspera is adapted to arid conditions and is often found in disturbed or open habitats.
